maml:description.maml:para: Adds a firewall rule to the specified Data Lake Store account.
The Add-AzureRmDataLakeStoreFirewallRule cmdlet adds a firewall rule to the specified Data Lake Store account.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Data Lake Store account to add the firewall rule to
The name of the firewall rule to add.
The start of the valid ip range for the firewall rule
The end of the valid ip range for the firewall rule
Name of resource group under which the account to add the firewall rule is.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The Data Lake Store account to add the firewall rule to
The end of the valid ip range for the firewall rule
The name of the firewall rule to add.
Name of resource group under which the account to add the firewall rule is.
The start of the valid ip range for the firewall rule
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: The firewall rule that was added.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add a new firewall rule to a Data Lake Store account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This creates a new firewall rule called "MyRule" in account "ContosoADL" with an IP range of 127.0.0.1 - 127.0.0.2

maml:description.maml:para: Adds content to an item in a Data Lake Store.
The Add-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemContent cmdlet adds content to an item in an Azure Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to modify, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the content to add to the item.
Specifies the encoding for the item to create. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Unknown
- String
- Unicode
- Byte
- BigEndianUnicode
- UTF8
- UTF7
- Ascii
- Default
- Oem
- BigEndianUTF32
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the encoding for the item to create. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Unknown
- String
- Unicode
- Byte
- BigEndianUnicode
- UTF8
- UTF7
- Ascii
- Default
- Oem
- BigEndianUTF32
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to modify, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the content to add to the item.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns true on success.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add content to a file

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds content to the file myFile.txt.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a trusted identity provider to the specified Data Lake Store account.
The Add-AzureRmDataLakeStoreTrustedIdProvider cmdlet adds a trusted identity provider to the specified Data Lake Store account.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the Data Lake Store account to add the specified trusted identity provider to.
The name of the trusted identity provider to add
The valid trusted provider endpoint in the format: https://sts.windows.net/<provider identity>"
Name of resource group under which the account to add the trusted identity provider is.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The name of the Data Lake Store account to add the specified trusted identity provider to.
The name of the trusted identity provider to add
The valid trusted provider endpoint in the format: https://sts.windows.net/<provider identity>"
Name of resource group under which the account to add the trusted identity provider is.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: The added Trusted Identity Provider.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add a trusted identity provider

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds the provider "MyProvider" to account "ContosoADL" with the provider endpoint "https://sts.windows.net/6b04908c-b91f-40ce-8024-7ee8a4fd6150"

maml:description.maml:para: Downloads a file from Data Lake Store.
The Export-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet downloads a file from Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the path of the item to download from the Data Lake Store, starting from the root directory (/).
Specifies the local file path to which to download the file.
Indicates that a folder download is recursive.
Indicates that the file or files being copied are a continuation of a previous download. The download attempts to resume from the last file that was not fully downloaded.
Specifies the maximum number of threads to use per file. The default value is ten (10).
Specifies the maximum number of files to download in parallel for a folder download. The default value is five (5).
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination file if it already exists.
Optionally indicates the diagnostic log level to use to record events during the file or folder import. Default is Error.
Specifies the path for the diagnostic log to record events to during the file or folder import.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the maximum number of files to download in parallel for a folder download. The default value is five (5).
Specifies the local file path to which to download the file.
Optionally indicates the diagnostic log level to use to record events during the file or folder import. Default is Error.
Specifies the path for the diagnostic log to record events to during the file or folder import.
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination file if it already exists.
Specifies the path of the item to download from the Data Lake Store, starting from the root directory (/).
Specifies the maximum number of threads to use per file. The default value is ten (10).
Indicates that a folder download is recursive.
Indicates that the file or files being copied are a continuation of a previous download. The download attempts to resume from the last file that was not fully downloaded.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: The path where the file or folder was downloaded to.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Download an item from the Data Lake Store

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command downloads the file TestSource.csv from the Data Lake Store to C:\Test.csv.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets details of a Data Lake Store account.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreAccount cmdlet gets details of a Data Lake Store account.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the account to get.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account to get.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account to get.
Specifies the name of the account to get.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account to get.

maml:description.maml:para: The specific Data Lake Store account asked for.
A list of Data Lake Store accounts in the resource group or subscription specified.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get a Data Lake Store account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the account named ContosoADL.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the list of items in a folder in Data Lake Store.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreChildItem cmdlet gets the list of items in a folder in Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the folder, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the folder, starting with the root directory (/).

maml:description.maml:para: The list of Data Lake Store files and folders under the specified path.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get the child items for a folder

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the child items for the MyFiles folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the specified firewall rules in the specified Data Lake Store. If no firewall rule is specified, then lists all firewall rules for the account.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreFirewallRule cmdlet gets the specified firewall rules in the specified Data Lake Store. If no firewall rule is specified, then lists all firewall rules for the account.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Data Lake Store account to retrieve the firewall rule from.
The name of the firewall rule to retrieve
Name of resource group under which want to retrieve the specified account's specified firewall rule.
The Data Lake Store account to retrieve the firewall rule from.
The name of the firewall rule to retrieve
Name of resource group under which want to retrieve the specified account's specified firewall rule.

maml:description.maml:para: The specified firewall rule to retrieve
The list of firewall rules in the specified account.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Retrieve a specific firewall rule

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the firewall rule named "MyFirewallRule" from account "ContosoADL"

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: List all firewall rules in an account

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all firewall rules in account "ContosoADL"

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the details of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet gets the details of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.

Specifies the Data Lake Store path from which to get details of an item, starting with the root directory (/).

maml:description.maml:para: The file or folder at the path specified.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get details of a file from the Data Lake Store

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the details of the file Test.csv from the Data Lake Store.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets an entry in the ACL of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAclEntry cmdlet gets an entry (ACE) in the access control list (ACL) of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.

Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item for which this cmdlet gets an ACE, starting with the root directory (/).

maml:description.maml:para: The list of ACL entries for the specified folder or file.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the ACL for the root directory of the specified Data Lake Store account

maml:description.maml:para: Uploads a local file or directory to a Data Lake Store.
The Import-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet uploads a local file or directory to a Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the local path of the file or folder to upload.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path to which to upload a file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).
Indicates that this operation should upload all items in all subfolders.
Indicates that this operation should resume a previously canceled or failed upload.
Indicates that this operation uploads the file as a binary file.
Specifies the maximum number of threads to use per file. The default value is ten (10).
Specify the maximum number of files to upload in parallel for a folder upload. The default value is five (5).
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination file if it already exists.
Optionally indicates the diagnostic log level to use to record events during the file or folder import. Default is Error.
Specifies the path for the diagnostic log to record events to during the file or folder import.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Specify the maximum number of files to upload in parallel for a folder upload. The default value is five (5).
Specifies the Data Lake Store path to which to upload a file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).

Specifies the path for the diagnostic log to record events to during the file or folder import.

Indicates that this operation uploads the file as a binary file.

Indicates that this operation should resume a previously canceled or failed upload.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: The full path in the Data Lake Store account to the uploaded file or folder.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command uploads the file SrcFile.csv and adds it to the MyFiles folder in the Data Lake Store as File.csv.

maml:description.maml:para: Moves or renames a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Move-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet moves or renames a file or folder in Data Lake Store.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Data Lake Store account.
The New-AzureRmDataLakeStoreAccount cmdlet creates a new Data Lake Store account.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the account.
Specifies the name of the account to create.
Specifies the location to use for the account. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- East US 2
Specifies the object ID of the AzureActive Directory group to use as the default group owner for new files and folders.
Specifies tags as key-value pairs. You can use tags to identify a Data Lake Store account from other Azure resources.
Indicates that the account will not have any form of encryption applied to it.
The desired commitment tier for this account to use.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the account.
Specifies the name of the account to create.
Specifies the location to use for the account. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- East US 2

Specifies tags as key-value pairs. You can use tags to identify a Data Lake Store account from other Azure resources.
The desired commitment tier for this account to use.
Specifies the object ID of the AzureActive Directory group to use as the default group owner for new files and folders.
Indicates that the account will not have any form of encryption applied to it.
Specifies the location to use for the account. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- East US 2
Specifies the name of the account to create.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the account.
Specifies tags as key-value pairs. You can use tags to identify a Data Lake Store account from other Azure resources.
The desired commitment tier for this account to use.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Remove-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet deletes a file or folder in Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies an array of Data Lake Store paths of the files to remove, starting with the root directory (/).
Indicates that this operation deletes all items in the target folder, including subfolders. Unless you specify the Clean parameter, the target folder is also deleted.
Indicates that this operation removes all of the contents of the target folder and retains the folder. Use this parameter with the Recurse parameter.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an entry from the ACL of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Remove-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAclEntry cmdlet removes an entry (ACE) from the access control list (ACL) of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item from which to remove an ACE, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the type of ACE to remove. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- User
- Group
- Mask
- Other
Specifies the object ID of the AzureActive Directory user, group, or service principal for which to remove an ACE.
Indicates that this operation removes the default ACE from the specified ACL.
Indicates a boolean response should be returned indicating the result of the delete operation.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies a Data Lake Store account.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreAccount cmdlet modifies a Data Lake Store account.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of a Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the ID of an AzureActive Directory group. This group is the default group for files and folders that you create.
Specifies tags as key-value pairs. You can use tags to identify a Data Lake Store account from other Azure resources.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account to modify.
Optionally enable or disable the existing trusted ID providers.
Optionally enable or disable existing firewall rules.
Optionally allow/block Azure originating IPs through the firewall.
The desired commitment tier for this account to use.
Optionally allow/block Azure originating IPs through the firewall.
Specifies the ID of an AzureActive Directory group. This group is the default group for files and folders that you create.
Optionally enable or disable existing firewall rules.
Specifies the name of a Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account to modify.
Specifies tags as key-value pairs. You can use tags to identify a Data Lake Store account from other Azure resources.
The desired commitment tier for this account to use.
Optionally enable or disable the existing trusted ID providers.

maml:description.maml:para: The updated account details.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add a tag to an account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds the specified tag to the Data Lake Store account named ContosoADL.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies the specified firewall rule in the specified Data Lake Store.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreFirewallRule cmdlet modifies the specified firewall rule in the specified Data Lake Store.

The name of the firewall rule.
The start of the valid ip range for the firewall rule
The end of the valid ip range for the firewall rule

The Data Lake Store account to update the firewall rule in
The end of the valid ip range for the firewall rule
The name of the firewall rule.

The start of the valid ip range for the firewall rule
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Update the start and end IP range for a firewall rule

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the firewall rule "MyFirewallRule" in account "ContosoADL" to have a range of 127.0.0.1 - 127.0.0.2

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies the ACL of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAcl cmdlet modifies the access control list (ACL) of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies an ACL for a file or a folder.
Indicates the resulting ACL should be returned.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies an ACL for a file or a folder.
Indicates the resulting ACL should be returned.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: If PassThru is specified, will return the resulting list of ACL entries.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the ACL for a file and a folder
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$ACL = Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAcl -AccountName "ContosoADL" -Path / PS C:\> Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAcl -AccountName "ContosoADL" -Path "/MyFiles/Test.txt" -Acl $ACL

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets the ACL for the root directory of the ContosoADL account, and then stores it in the $ACL variable.
The second command sets the ACL for the file Test.txt to the one in $ACL.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets or removes the expire time for a file in an Azure Data Lake Store account.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemExpiry cmdlet sets or removes the expire time for a file in an Azure Data Lake Store account.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Data Lake Store account name.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file item for which to set or remove expiry.
The absolute expiration time for the specified file. If no value or set to MaxValue, the file will never expire.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the Data Lake Store account name.
The absolute expiration time for the specified file. If no value or set to MaxValue, the file will never expire.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file item for which to set or remove expiry.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: The updated file with a new expiration time.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the expiration time for a file

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets expiration on the file myfile.txt in account ContosoADL to be two hours from now. This will cause the file to expire (be marked for delete) in two hours.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Remove the expiration on a file

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes any expiration that was previously set on file 'myfile.txt' in account 'ContosoADL'. This means the file will not automatically expire (be marked for delete) and will need to be manually deleted or set to expire again.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies the owner of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemOwner cmdlet modifies the owner of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to modify, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the type of owner to set. The acceptable values for this parameter are: User and Group.
Specifies the object ID of the AzureActive Directory user, group, or service principal to use as the owner.
Indicates the resulting updated owner should be returned.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the object ID of the AzureActive Directory user, group, or service principal to use as the owner.
Indicates the resulting updated owner should be returned.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to modify, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the type of owner to set. The acceptable values for this parameter are: User and Group.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: If PassThru is specified, returns the updated owner.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the owner for an item

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the owner for the root directory to Patti Fuller.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies the permission octal of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemPermission cmdlet modifies the permission octal of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Data Lake Store account name.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).
The permissions to set for the file or folder, expressed as an octal (e.g. '777')
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the Data Lake Store account name.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).
The permissions to set for the file or folder, expressed as an octal (e.g. '777')
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns true upon successfully updating the permission.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the permission octal for an item

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the permission octal for a file to 0770, which translates to clearing the sticky bit, setting read/write/execute permissions for the owner of the file, setting read/write/execute permissions for the owning group of the file, and clearing read/write/execute permissions for other.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies the specified trusted identity provider in the specified Data Lake Store.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreTrustedIdProvider cmdlet modifies the specified trusted identity provider in the specified Data Lake Store.

Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

The name of the trusted identity provider.
The valid trusted provider endpoint in the format: https://sts.windows.net/<provider identity>

Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Update a Trusted Identity Provider Endpoint

dev:remarks.maml:para: This updates the provider endpoing for firewall rule "MyProvider" in account "ContosoADL" to "https://sts.windows.net/6b04908c-b91f-40ce-8024-7ee8a4fd6150"

maml:description.maml:para: Tests the existence of a Data Lake Store account.
The Test-AzureRmDataLakeStoreAccount cmdlet tests the existence of a Data Lake Store account.

Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the account to test.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account to test.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the account to test.

maml:description.maml:para: True or false indicating the existence of the specified account.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Test an account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command tests whether the account named ContosoADL exists.

maml:description.maml:para: Tests the existence of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Test-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet tests the existence of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to test, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the type of item to test. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Any
- File
- Folder

Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to test, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the type of item to test. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Any
- File
- Folder

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command tests whether the file Test.csv exists in the ContosoADL account.
